title: Construction Worker / Laborer
description:
Consider joining EV Construction in one of our trade divisions! Since our founding in 1945, we’ve always been just as proud of the people behind the work as the buildings we construct. We work hard to help our team, our clients and our communities thrive by believing that every good endeavor is Built Around People. As a result of this commitment to people and our world-class safety program, EV... Construction is consistently rated a top place to work in the country. We’ve been fortunate enough to work in a variety of industries over the years, including healthcare, industrial, food processing, non-profit, senior living, and other highly regulated sectors.

This role could support any of the listed divisions and would have the opportunity to grow into a role where they would specialize in a trade in the long term. Our divisions include the following:
• Painting and Drywall
• Interiors
• Sitework
• General Trades / Carpentry
• Firestop
• Facilities Services

Candidates should model character (ability to be trusted), chemistry (ability to work well with others) and competence (ability to work with skill). Attention to detail, pride in your work, reliability, and good attendance are necessary for the role. The ability to travel is a plus. This role works primarily indoors and workload is consistent year-round.

Qualifications:
• Ability to pass a background check and drug screen
• Must have reliable transportation. This role works throughout West Michigan regularly. Ability to work throughout Michigan a plus (compensation for travel provided).
• Eligible to work in the US
• High School diploma or GED
• General familiarity with construction tools and materials. Must be able to accurately read a tape measure and use hand tools.
• Ability to follow instructions from supervisors
• Ability to perform basic math

Physical Requirements:
• Lift and carry 25 pounds regularly, 50 pounds or more occasionally
• Must be able to see details at close range
• Will work for prolonged periods standing in a variety of conditions
• Must have good manual dexterity, good sense of balance, good hand-eye coordination
• Must be able to perform work on scaffolding and / or ladders
• Must be able to work at heights in powered lifts
• Must be able to work at or above shoulder height for extended periods of time

Compensation:
• Competitive wages
• Paid training
• Insurance
• Health
• Dental
• Optical
• Life
• Short-Term Disability
• Long-Term Disability
• AD&D
• 401(k) with match
• Paid Holidays
• Paid Time Off
• Annual Bonuses
• Uniform Provided
• EAP and Company Chaplain
• And Much More!

Powered by JazzHR

title: Construction Worker - Carpenter - Now Hiring
description:
Morton Buildings, Inc. is the industry leader in post-frame construction. We have been in business for 120 years and have more than 10 manufacturing, fabrication, and shipping plants servicing over 100 construction centers nationwide. Per year, across America, thousands of new buildings sport the familiar Morton M.

Salary is $20.00 to $22.00 per hour based on experience. Paid Weekly...

Bonus! Earn an additional $2000 your first year. New crew members receive an additional $500 bonus every quarter during their first year of employment with Morton Buildings. These bonuses are subject to all applicable withholding taxes.

Under the guidance of your crew foreman you will:
• Learn, keep current with and apply the Morton Buildings' safety and construction procedures, methods, and standards
• Read, understand and build according to construction plans
• Utilize various tools and equipment to safely and efficiently construct buildings
• Efficiently execute tasks such as: digging and installing footings, framing walls and roof structures, installing windows, entry and other doors and door openings, installing various siding and roofing materials including hi-rib steel, shingles, wood and other siding materials and mortarless masonry units, finishing with metal and wood trims
• Work with other crew personnel in a safe, organized, productive and enjoyable work environment treating everyone with dignity and respect

QUALIFICATIONS
• Building construction (post-frame), carpentry or framing experience preferred (on the job or in school)
• Willingness to participate in and complete a training program
• A valid driver’s license is preferred; Class A CDL is highly desired.
• Available to work 9-10 hours during peak construction season.
• Ability to take direction
• Produce quality work in an efficient manner
• Agree to comply with all our safety processes and procedures
• Willingness to maintain and operate construction tools in a safe and proper manner
• Ability to operate specialized safety equipment efficiently and effectively
• Standard weight lifting requirements - 50 pounds, with occasional lifting up to 100 pounds
• Capable of working in a physically demanding environment and at various heights (up to 40 feet)
• Possess good communication skills - both written and verbal
• This position requires 10% travel (based on 52 weeks), which includes overnight travel possibly up to two weeks at a time.

Benefits include:
• $500 quarterly retention bonus for the first year of employment
• Employee Stock Ownership Program (ESOP)
• Excellent medical/dental/prescription coverage
• Life Insurance
• Training bonus
• Safety incentives
• Paid holidays
• Paid vacation
• Paid sick time
• Bad weather pay
• 401K Opportunity
• AND SO MUCH MORE...

Our construction crew positions are eligible for three years of progressive pay increases based upon experience, required training, and attendance.

Morton Buildings, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and Drug-Free Workplace.

All candidates offered employment will be subject to a pre-placement test which does include a drug screen

title: Construction Laborer
description:
Location: Across Michigan

About Miller LS Bridge Construction...

Our team at Miller LS Bridge Construction is dedicated to delivering exceptional heavy highway construction projects across Michigan. We deeply value our workforce and are committed to ensuring their safety, fostering growth, and achieving success.

Our dedication to excellence is evident in our strong connections within the community, as we continuously serve and shape the future of Miller LS Bridge Construction. We remain focused on our growth trajectory by continuously enhancing the skill levels of our existing team members and new recruits, thereby cultivating a highly skilled workforce to better serve our Michigan community.

We are an equal opportunity employer and will not unlawfully discriminate based on race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or veteran status, the presence of a medical condition or disability, height, weight, or any other protected status.

Benefits: Health Insurance, Health Savings Account, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Paid Time Off, Life Insurance

Transportation: Miller LS Bridge Construction manages multiple projects across Michigan, requiring transportation to and from various job sites for this role.

Physical Condition: As a Construction Laborer, the job entails significant physical exertion. Anticipate long hours standing, lifting, and frequently bending and kneeling throughout the project.

We reserve the right to mandate physical examinations, drug screenings, and background checks for our employees.

Job Summary:

As a Construction Laborer, you will play a vital role in supporting various construction projects by performing a range of tasks essential to project completion. Your responsibilities will include but are not limited to: working around heavy machinery, pouring concrete, ensuring site safety, assisting tradesmen, distributing materials, erecting and dismantling structures, using hand and power tools, and working in all weather conditions. This position requires an individual with quick learning and effective communication skills. If you are a committed individual with a strong work ethic and a willingness to contribute to team efforts, we invite you to join our construction team. Expect to work cautiously alongside live highway traffic and people, at elevated heights up to 50 feet, and carrying heavy materials up to 50 lbs throughout a variety of weather conditions such as rain, snow, sleet, fog, etc.

Job Responsibilities:
• Excavate trenches and pour concrete: Digging trenches to specified depths and dimensions, and then pouring concrete into these excavated areas to create foundations, footings, or other structural elements.
• Ensure safety by setting up barricades and controlling traffic: Erecting traffic barricades, cones, and markers to redirect vehicles away from work zones, as well as managing traffic flow to ensure the safety of workers and pedestrians.
• Assist tradesmen and operate machinery: Providing support to tradesmen (carpenters, welders, etc.), by carrying materials, holding components in place, and operating machinery such as concrete mixers, jackhammers, or chainsaws as required.
• Prepare job sites and distribute materials according to plans: Cleaning and organizing the work area, loading, and unloading building materials from delivery trucks, and distributing them to designated locations based on construction plans and specifications.
• Clear debris and hazards from construction sites: Removing rubble, trash, and other debris from the work area to maintain a safe and organized environment for construction activities.
• Erect and dismantle structures as needed: Assemble temporary structures such as scaffolding or bracing to support construction projects and dismantle them once the work is complete.
• Utilizing various hand and power tools: Operating a wide range of tools including hammers, saws, drills, and power tools like pneumatic nail guns or concrete vibrators to perform construction tasks efficiently.
• Follow instructions and aid other trades on site: Adhering to construction plans and instructions provided by supervisors or lead workers, while also assisting other tradespeople with their tasks as needed.
• Work conditions: Performing duties in outdoor environments regardless of weather conditions, working cautiously near and around live highway traffic and people, and occasionally working at elevated heights using ladders or mobile equipment while carrying materials weighing up to 50 lbs.

Please be aware that this job description may not include all the activities, duties, and responsibilities required for this role. Duties and responsibilities may be subject to change with or without notice. These changes entailed may be in accordance with, but are not limited to job site conditions, work and weather conditions, tasks, and labor necessary per job site, etc.

Qualifications:

Education:
• Preferred: High school diploma or GED. Further education is not necessary but preferred.
• While further education is not mandatory, documentation highlighting certificates or trade-related schooling can strengthen your application and potentially lead to higher wage opportunities.

Experience:
• Although experience is not a strict requirement, it is preferred.
• Providing documentation that outlines your construction or other trade-related experience can improve your chances of receiving higher wage opportunities and strengthen your application.

On the Job Training Program:

We encourage those of minorities, women, and disadvantaged persons to apply. This program, offered by the Michigan Department of Transportation, aims to ensure equal opportunities for minorities, women, and disadvantaged individuals to receive training in highway construction trades.

For more information: On-the-Job Training (OJT) Program (michigan.gov)

The construction season is set to begin in March/April 2024.

Prevailing Wage Range: $39.12-$39.82

If you are interested in joining our team as a Construction Laborer, please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
• Dental insurance
• Health insurance
• Health savings account
• Life insurance
• On-the-job training
• Paid time off
• Vision insurance

Schedule:
• Monday to Friday
• Overtime
• Weekends as needed

People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply

Education:
• High school or equivalent (Required)

Work Location: In person

items: This position requires an individual with quick learning and effective communication skills
Providing documentation that outlines your construction or other trade-related experience can improve your chances of receiving higher wage opportunities and strengthen your application
People with a criminal record are encouraged to apply
High school or equivalent (Required)

Assist tradesmen and operate machinery: Providing support to tradesmen (carpenters, welders, etc.), by carrying materials, holding components in place, and operating machinery such as concrete mixers, jackhammers, or chainsaws as required

Utilizing various hand and power tools: Operating a wide range of tools including hammers, saws, drills, and power tools like pneumatic nail guns or concrete vibrators to perform construction tasks efficiently

title: Skilled Construction Worker
description:
Looking for someone with residential construction, remodeling and pole barn building experience. This position is a full time permanent position. Hours vary depending on work load. Experience is needed. Job responsibilities include but are not limited to:
• Preparing construction sites, materials, and tools.
• Accurately read a tape measure and cutting material accordingly...
• Loading and unloading of materials, tools, and equipment.
• Position and secure materials within structures.
• Removing debris, garbage, and dangerous materials from sites.
• Assembling and breaking down temporary structures, and scaffolding.
• Assisting contractors, e.g. electricians and painters, as required.
• Assisting with transport and operation of heavy machinery and equipment.
• Digging holes.
• Mixing, pouring, and leveling concrete.

Typical end time:
• 4PM

Typical start time:
• 7AM

This Job Is:
• Open to applicants who do not have a high school diploma/GED
• Open to applicants who do not have a college diploma

Work Remotely
• No

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $20.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Schedule:
• 10 hour shift
• 8 hour shift
• Day shift
• Monday to Friday

Ability to commute/relocate:
• Gladwin, MI 48624: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Construction Worker
description:
We are seeking hardworking and reliable Construction Laborers to join our team. As a Construction Laborer, you will work on various construction sites, assisting with the completion of projects. This is a physically demanding role that requires the ability to perform manual labor tasks and work in various weather conditions.

Responsibilities...
- Assist with the setup and cleanup of construction sites
- Load and unload materials and equipment
- Operate hand tools and power tools as directed
- We specialize in deck and stair building with the occasional seawall, assist with other general construction tasks
- Follow safety protocols and wear appropriate personal protective equipment (PPE)
- Collaborate with team members to ensure efficient project completion
- Perform other duties as assigned

Requirements:
- High school diploma or equivalent
- Previous experience in construction or a related field is preferred but not required
- Ability to perform physical labor and lift heavy objects (up to 50 pounds)
- Basic knowledge of construction tools and equipment
- Strong work ethic and willingness to learn
- Ability to follow instructions and work well in a team environment
- Communication skills
- Valid driver's license

Please note that this position may require occasional overtime, depending on project deadlines.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $20.00 - $30.00 per hour

Expected hours: 40 per week

Benefits:
• Paid training
• Safety equipment provided
• Tools provided

Schedule:
• 8 hour shift
• Monday to Friday
• No nights

Ability to Relocate:
• Traverse City, MI: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

Helping operate heavy equipment and additional construction labor tasks when needed

General drywall work and frame carpentry

Some basic electrical and plumbing

Other forms of basic construction Labor

Qualified candidates must have the following:

Able to stand, walk, crouch stoop and sit for varying times during shifts up to 12 hours long
Lift and carry 50 pounds for sustained distances
Have a high school diploma or equivalent At least 1 year of construction experience

Must have a driver license

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $16.00 per hour

Schedule:
• 10 hour shift
• 8 hour shift

License/Certification:
• Driver's License (Preferred)

Work Location: On the road

title: Construction Worker (Caprenter/Laborer)
description:
JOB TITLE:

Construction Worker (Carpenter/Laborer...

POSITION SUMMARY:

Construct, erect, install, and repair structures and fixtures of wood, plywood, and wallboard, using power tools; install framing, and seal joints between plasterboard or other wallboard to prepare wall surface for painting or papering. Demolition of existing structures, assisting in the concrete work of new structures, maintaining a clean and safe work environment, aiding in traffic control and assisting in material handling throughout the job site.

MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Designs, constructs, remodels, retrofits and repairs interior and exterior structures made of wood, drywall, plaster, concrete and brick.
• Shape or cut materials to specified measurements, using hand tools, machines, or power saw.
• Measure and mark cutting lines on materials, using ruler, pencil, chalk, and marking gauge.
• Verify trueness of structure, using plumb bob and level. Assemble and fasten materials to make framework or props, using hand tools and wood screws, nails, dowel pins, or glue.
• Remove damaged or defective parts or sections of structures and repair or replace, using hand tools.
• Assemble or install metal framing or decorative trim for windows, doorways, or vents.
• Cut and screw together metal channels to make floor or ceiling frames, according to plans for the location of rooms or hallways.
• Erect scaffolding and ladders for assembling structures above ground level.
• Perform variety of tasks that require utilizing various tools, such as demolishing buildings, dismantling forms, setting up pumps and hoses, removing projections from concrete and cleaning tools and equipment as needed
• Signal operators of construction equipment to facilitate alignment, movement, and adjustment of machinery
• Level earth to fine grade specifications
• Transport, pour, vibrate, and grade concrete into existing formwork
• Maintain a clean and safe worksite by sweeping, picking up debris, transporting tools/equipment, dumping debris, removing snow, maintaining perimeter fall protection, or any other assignments.
• Assist in worksite safety by installing and removing barricades, setting up road signage, flagging and assisting with rigging items to crane as needed
• Perform final and general clean-up of a space including mopping, dusting, removal of floor protection, etc.

POSITION REQUIREMENTS:
• Proficiency in operating skidsteer or telehandler.
• Must successful complete essential physical functions evaluation and drug and alcohol testing as coordinated by employer.

Power Construction is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. Power Construction is committed to increasing opportunities for historically disadvantaged workers (including women and members of disproportionately affected racial and ethnic groups), as well as residents of marginalized communities.

Apply Now
